question: 複数形
sourceMnemonic: If <ja>複数</ja> is <kanji>multiple</kanji>, and <ja>形</ja> is <kanji>shape</kanji>, then when something is in a "multiple shape," it has more than one version of itself. It's the <vocabulary>plural</vocabulary>, or the <vocabulary>plural form</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Will help to know the word <ja>複数</ja> as well.
